entry.title: The Place With the Most Lithium Is Blowing the Electric-Car Revolution
entry.content: A California-sized piece of South America is stifling production of lithium at a time when battery makers desperately need it.

entry.title: Facing Gas Cuts, Europe Dims Lights, Cools Pools and Shortens Showers
entry.content: Across Europe, national and local governments are pushing to reduce energy usage as Russia cuts its gas shipments in response to Western sanctions during the war in Ukraine.

entry.title: Ukraine Holds the Line in Donbas as Russian Fire Shatters Cities
entry.content: Bakhmut, a once elegant Ukrainian town famous for its sparkling wines, is now the focus of fighting in Donbas as cluster munitions maim civilians and the infrastructure gets slowly destroyed.
